SEARCH
Package edu.baylor.GroupFive.database.daos

Interface Dao<T>

Type Parameters:
T - Object this DAO is meant to interact with
All Known Subinterfaces:
ReservationDao
All Known Implementing Classes:
ReservationServices
public interface Dao<T>
Dao<T> is an interface that represents the base functionalities for all *DAO objects in our project. We allow the user to retrieve a connection to our database along with the following functionality: DriverManager.getConnection() throws either an SQLException or SQLTimeoutException upon fail. Note that a SQLTimeExceptions are swallowed by SQLExceptions. https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/sql/DriverManager.html#getConnection-java.lang.String- get(int) getAll() save(Object) insert(Object) update(Object) delete(Object)
Author:
Icko

  • Method Details

    • get

      T get(int id) throws SQLException
      Retrieves an object from our database matching the specified id.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of object.
      Returns:
      Object if found. null if not.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If error occurs during database communication.

    • getAll

      List<T> getAll() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all objects in our database.
      Returns:
      A List of objects.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If error occurs during database communication.

    • save

      Integer save(T t) throws SQLException
      Either inserts or updates based on our database.
      Parameters:
      t - Object to save.
      Returns:
      Number of rows affected by query.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If error occurs during database communication.

    • insert

      Integer insert(T t) throws SQLException
      Inserts an object into our database.
      Parameters:
      t - Object to insert.
      Returns:
      Number of rows affected by query.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If error occurs during database communication.

    • update

      Integer update(T t) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing object in our database.
      Parameters:
      t - Object with new changes.
      Returns:
      Number of rows affected by query.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If error occurs during database communication.

    • delete

      Integer delete(T t) throws SQLException
      "Deletes" an object in our database. Does this by setting an active flag from true to false. We should not actually be deleting anything from the database except for drastic reasons
      Parameters:
      t - Object to delete.
      Returns:
      Number of rows affected by query.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If error occurs during database communication.
